content: needle pick up and k12 12 16 16 16 sts down the left side of the heel combine the sts on the next two needles by slipping them onto one needle there should be 26 28 30 32 34 sts on this needle on needle two k all sts on the needle using your free needle pick up and k12 12 16 16 16 sts up the right side of the heel with this same needle k8 8 9 9 10 from the needle with the heel sts on it slip the remaining sts from the heel needle onto the first needle you should have 20 20 25 25 26 sts on the first and third needles you should have 26 28 30 32 34 sts on the second needle instep row 1 needle one k to last 3 sts on needle k2tog k1 one stitch decreased needle two p2tog 13 14 15 16 17 times needle three k1 ssk k to end of needle one stitch decreased row 2 needle one k to end of needle needle two kfb 13 14 15 16 17 times needle three k to end of needle row 3 needle one k to last 3 sts on needle k2tog k1 one stitch decreased needle two k all sts needle three k1 ssk k to end of needle one stitch decreased row 4 k all sts copyright 2019 yarn café creations christy houghton vanilla soufflé by christy houghton 4 repeat row 1 4 of instep until there are 13 14 15 16 17 sts on needles one and three ending with a decrease row you should have 26 28 30 32 34 sts on needle two section 4 the foot begin this section with row 2 4 4 2 2 to continue in pattern row 1 k13 14 15 16 17 p2tog 13 14 15 16 17 times k13 14 15 16 17 row 2 k13 14 15 16 17 kfb 13 14 15 16 17 times k13 14 15 16 17 row 3 and 4 k all sts repeat row 1 - 4 until the foot of the sock measures approximately 6 6 5 7 0 7 5 8 0 from the back of the heel these are approximations there will be about 1/2 of negative ease in the sock depending on the content of the yarn used section 5 the toe row 1 needle one k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle two k1 ssk k to last 3 sts k2tog k1 needle three k1 ssk k to end four stitches decreased row 2 k all sts repeat row 1 and 2 until there are 4 sts on needles one and three and 8 sts on needle two using needle three k the four sts on needle one you should now have 8 sts on each of the two remaining needles cut yarn leaving a tail of at least 12 long thread tapestry needle and graft toe closed using the kitchener stitch
